metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0472 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The django.core.urlresolvers.reverse function in Django before 1.4.11, 1.5.x before 1.5.6, 1.6.x before 1.6.3, and 1.7.x before 1.7 beta 2 allows remote attackers to import and execute arbitrary Python modules by leveraging a view that constructs URLs using user input and a "dotted Python path."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.6.1-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-2ubuntu0.1').
